intro: Spermacoce roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
